message.body: Hi Jurgen. How's it going?
Not so bad. Bureaucratic headache: trying to track down a package gone astray.
How about you?
Oh no, I hope it's not USPS
If it is you may be doomed
reparing Shipment" (caps per original).
ickup. Foolishly I hadn't specified tracking, though I did check "if undeliverable return to sender". All the USPS website tells me is "Origin Post is P
Yes and no. I sent a package including a new Kindle to Japan. The addressee, a gaijin, wasn't familiar with their procedures and missed the window for p
I sent it in February. :-(
I'm just filling out spreadsheets at work. Nothing too fun on my end
So frustrating. I sent a package to Mexico City via USPS in December and it didn't arrive till the end of march!
Yeh. I've got a bunch of documentation to prep, and also to acknowledge & OK the boss's evaluation. It's that time of year here.
low boat the long way 'round.
Grrrr. I made sure mine went by air.I have a lot more faith in the Japanese postal system than in ours. But for all I know out Mary be coming back via s
And I DO NOT TRUST my local PO. ("PO'ed" is appropriate!) Stuff goes missing there, a lot.
Ach, *may*be coming back.
Well I guess all you can do now is get a lucky rabbits foot
Not so lucky for the poor rabbit.
Yeah a guess a 4 leaf clover would be a bit more humane
Yeah. Or knocking on wood.
That would be best thing to do
(Looks around. Sees no wood. Knocks on own head instead.)
Ha! I do that too!
It's a funny thing to believe in
Ever hear the famous Niels Bohr quote about the reason he kept a lucky horse shoe over his workshop?
Workshop door that is
Tell me. I won't be Bohred.
Good one
Bohr was asked by a friend why, if he believed in science, did he keep a superstitious horseshoe over the door.
Bohr answered, because I am told it works even if you don't believe in it.
Slavoj Zizek likes to bring up that quote a lot
Fair enough. As long as it's well fastened. Having it fall on your head because someone's hammering nearby - not improbable in a workshop - would be ver
y bad luck indeed!
Who's Slavoj Zizek?
He's a contemporary philosopher
He is the most fun philosopher to see speak
Thanks. Lunch time now. Continue later?
There are tons of videos of him on YouTube
I'll look later in free time
Sure, enjoy the lunch
Right now I'm enjoying the weather. Nice day to take a break-snack outdoors.
How was lunch?
he dressing oozed out of the bag and I had to clean up the table w sponge & soapy water, also inside my lunchbox. Yours?
Not bad. Leftovers from home; Trader Joe's beef chili, rice, salad w the last of some dressing I made w olive oil and fresh lime juice. Messy, though. T
That sounds like a much better lunch than I had.
I got a food truck gyro
That doesn't sound too bad, depending of course on how well the y do w the gyro. Any drink?
Just a soda because it came withe the gyro.
I don't usually drink soda.
The gyro wasn't too bad
But then there 's ginger beer, ahhhh!
Ginger beer is great
So is real root beer
And just beer in general isn't bad
Yeah!
I discovered ginger beer on our honeymoon on Jamaica. They do It *right*!
(interspersing this with writing xxxxxx working on that documentation)
(but documentation interspurted w ginger beer would be a REALLY BAD idea!)
How is ginger beer different in Jamaica?
Strong! I think they may have invented it. But maybe I was misleading, I don't think I knew about it before then.
Anyway, TJ's sellsa brand that's from there, Adams maybe???
(cursing at MS Word)
I've had Reed's extra strong ginger beer at the Greenline cafe. It is painfully refreshing. Is that the kind you drank in Jamaica?
I remember a lot of details of my honeymoon (MYOB :-) ) but not that. Reed's, that's the brand at TJ's.
Yeah Reed's is pretty strong stuff.
Is that what you usually drink for lunch?
And that, imho, is part of doing out right.
It
I remember once eating r in a small storefront restaurant that was run by some Jehovah 's Witnesses. it was (what we would now call) vegan. I had some g
inger beer with me and asked if it was ok to drink that w my meal. "BEER? No!" "But look at the label, the ingredients." "Hmm. OK, then."
Was that the restaurant in W Philly run by the church group that used to live in and own the Divine Lorraine Hotel on Ridge st near Temple?
No, it was NYC, Lower East Side.
t I'd better make sure I'm right!"
Our rabbi told us about it. He'd eaten there occasionally - no meat, no milk, and all fruits & vegetables are basically intrinsically kosher. But a cong
regant had told him, "I saw you coming out of there and figured it must be kosher." So the rabbi decided "Well, if other Jews are counting on my judgmen
So he went to the owners and offered to check them for kashrut (compliance, kosherness). They were glad to: it's a heavily Jewish area, or was then.
They got some surprises. He found them using a kitchen cleanser made w animal products, which dismayed them and of courser they stopped using it.
Once they'd done things like that and cleaned the place appropriately, he wrote up a hecksher (kosher certificate) and they put it in their window. And
hopefully got more customers.
So the restaurant became kosher for him?! That's really cool.
When did this take place?
Late sixties or early seventies
That must have been a very interesting time to be in that area!
Oh, it was!
Hippies and immigrants from nearly all over. I remember on that same block a Ukrainian store that had fabrics and crafts. I still have a set or two of m
atrushka dolls my wife bought there.
And restaurants of various cuisines. Ah, yes, drat! I'm salivating just thinking about them!
That sounds really cool and delicious
Or ***HOT*** and delicious, as the case might be.
I can't manage HOT so well.
All this reminds me of another NYC restaurant I remember: the Green Tree, Hungarian place my dad used to go. Upper West side in think, around Columbia U.
I like hot foods but can't do wasabi
Been gone for many yrs now.
Oooh, I'm typoing so badly
Sorry I left work and had dinner. All that food talk made me hungry!
I grew up upstate outside of Syracuse and the restaurant scene was not that great growing up.
off and plug on
I just had dinner while your memos were coming in. And I was also trying to log my subnet in a calorie counter app...oh hell power critical got to shut
Wait, you have a calorie counter app? How does that work? Do you have to weigh the portions first?
A lot of them have "portions" as on the pkg.& also others. You can choose hm of a portion & often choose the "portion" size. E.g.,
What about bulk foods like nuts or fresh veggies?
They have plenty, w units by weight (oz, g) or volume (cup, mL...). You may have to convert though. I've memorized a couple of factors, and have a calcu
lator app that'll convert (RealCalc) & a kitchen measurements app.
Are you on a special diet or simply curious about your caloric intake?
The app itself is "myfitnesspal", much better than "CalorieCounter" -I've tried both.
en after we're done w our texting.
Got to go, got stuff to do b4 I collapse. Been nice chatting w you. I think we're anonymous in the project but u can leave a not in the kitchen for Jurg
Is each pair (e.g. You & me) once only? I Forget. If so then you can do so tomorrow.
I think you can chat over and over again with the same person if your availability matches up.
Good chatting with you too!
Have a good evening.
Ok. Well, real space contact when the project is t over.
You Can find the app now if u want, right?
Yes I can find the app and we can continue the discussion in the flesh if we see one another.
I don't know who you are.
It can be a game to figure it out!
Oy . Good nivht.
Good night to you too!
